workflow.summary: A customer-service workflow for express delivery inquiries: the agent asks for an order number to look up shipment details and prompts re-entry if not found. Once located, the system reports delivery status; for undelivered items the user can request a shipment push or check the current location, while for delivered items the user is asked whether they have received it and, if not, is directed to check a nearby Cainiao Station. If the delivery is received, the user’s satisfaction is queried and responded to with either thanks for positive feedback or assurance of improvement. The flow focuses on efficient tracking and resolving delivery issues to improve customer satisfaction.

workflow.text: The process begins with recommending a notebook and asking the buyer if they have a favorite brand from the options available: Honor, Xiaomi, and Asus. If the buyer doesn't have a preference, they are informed about the advantages of these brands, which include being lightweight, easy to carry, and high performance. If the buyer is willing to consider these options, a specific notebook recommendation is made. If not, an apology is extended for not being able to recommend a suitable notebook. If the buyer has a favorite brand, a notebook from that brand is recommended. If the buyer is not satisfied with the recommendation, another brand is suggested until satisfaction is achieved. Upon satisfaction, the buyer's preferences for screen size, color, and memory capacity are asked for, and the price of the recommended notebook is provided. If the buyer decides to purchase, they are reminded to make the payment through a shared link. If the buyer chooses not to buy, they are encouraged to think it over. This process ensures the buyer is guided through selecting a notebook that meets their preferences and needs, with options for reconsideration at each step.

apis.api_description: Suggestions are given for the quality problems of the laptop

is_phone.description: Telephone number of maintenance staff, e.g. "0233796".

apis.api_description: Check if the return conditions are met

return_matterr.description: Whether the laptop is damaged or not, enumeration type, [yes, no]

is_return.description: Whether the return condition is satisfied, enumeration type, [satisfied, not satisfied]

workflow.text: The flowchart outlines a process for handling laptop returns, starting with asking the user if the return is due to quality issues or simply because they changed their mind within a seven-day period. If the return is due to quality problems, the process involves calling an API to advise the user on how to address the issue by asking about the laptop model and specific problem, providing a solution, and checking if the problem is resolved. If not, the user is given technician contact information for further assistance. If the problem still persists, the possibility of a return is evaluated. If the return conditions are not met, the user is informed that a return is not possible. However, if a return is feasible, the user is instructed to bring the laptop to the store for inspection and potential return. On the other hand, if the return is within seven days for no specific reason, the user is asked if the laptop is well-packed. If yes, the return is processed; if not, the user is informed that the laptop cannot be returned unless the packaging is in good condition. This process ensures that returns due to quality issues are handled efficiently while also accommodating returns for other reasons within a specified timeframe.
workflow.code:
start:
    ask "Is the return due to quality issues or seven days with no reason?" -> quality_issues, no_reason

quality_issues:
    call API to inquire about the laptop model and specific problem
    call laptopMaintenance(solution)
    if solution is provided:
        ask "Is the quality problem resolved?" -> resolved, unresolved
    else:
        goto unresolved

resolved:
    inform "You can consult in the future if there are any related problems"
    end

unresolved:
    inform of technician's contact info
    ask "Is the problem solved now?" -> still_unresolved, resolved
    
still_unresolved:
    call returnCondition(is_return)
    if is_return:
        goto satisfied
    else:
        goto unsatisfied

satisfied:
    inform "Return the laptop to the store in Computer City for a check. If not damaged, return will be processed."
    end

unsatisfied:
    inform "Return condition not met, laptop cannot be returned."
    end

no_reason:
    ask "Is the laptop well-packed?" -> well_packed, not_well_packed

well_packed:
    inform "Send the laptop to the store, return will be processed."
    end

not_well_packed:
    inform "Laptop can not be returned unless packaging is in good condition."
    end

Call laptopMaintenance to provide a solution based on the returned is_solution,

workflow.summary: The workflow handles laptop returns by first asking whether the issue is a quality problem or a change of mind within seven days. For quality issues, it runs a troubleshooting flow (collect model and problem, provide solutions, check resolution), escalates to a technician if needed, and evaluates return eligibility if problems persist. For seven-day returns without defects, it verifies that the laptop is properly packed before processing; if packaging or return conditions fail, the user is informed that a return is not possible, otherwise the laptop is brought to the store for inspection and return.

apis.api_description: Send an email

is_support.description: Server return code, 200 is normal, others are errors

workflow.text: The process begins with sending an email, where the first step involves determining if the user has an email account by asking for their ID number and preferred email address. If the user has an account, the process moves on to judge if the recipient's email address is valid. Should the recipient's address be invalid, the user is informed and can choose to provide a different address or end the process. If willing to try again and a valid address is provided, the user is then asked if they wish to send the email immediately or later. Choosing to send it immediately triggers the email's dispatch, while opting to send it later gives the user the option to save the email content in the draft box for future use or not use the draft box at all, ending the process. If initially found without an email account, the user is advised to register for one before they can send emails. This entire flow encapsulates a user-friendly email management system that verifies user accounts, validates recipient addresses, offers draft saving options, and requires registration for account-less users, all aimed at facilitating smooth email communication.
workflow.code:
start: Start
    send_an_email()

send_an_email: Current goal: Determine whether the user has an email account
    Description: Ask the user for the ID number and the email address they want to use.
    Call accountInquiry to determine whether the user has an email account based on the returned is_posts
    if (has an email account) then (judge_email_availability)
    else (inform_user_to_register)

judge_email_availability: Current goal: Judge whether the recipient's email address is available
    Description: Ask the user for his/her email account.
    Call emailFeasibility and determine whether emails can be sent to the recipient based on the returned is_sent
    if (NO) then (inform_incorrect_account)
    else (ask_about_sending_email_now)
    
inform_incorrect_account: Current goal: Inform the user of the incorrect account number
    Description: Tell the user that the email cannot be sent because the recipient's email account is incorrect.
    Ask the user if he/she is willing to provide the recipient's email account again
    if (Unwilling to provide again) then (say_goodbye)
    else (judge_email_availability)
    
ask_about_sending_email_now: Current goal: Ask if the user wants to send an email now
    Description: Remind the user to confirm the subject and outline of the email.
    Call writeEmail and inform the user of the edited message based on the returned post_ending.
    And ask the user if they want to send the email now or later
    if (Send the email now) then (send_the_email)
    else (ask_user_draft_box)

send_the_email: Current goal: Send the email
    Description: Call enterEmail to send the email,
    and informs the user that the message has been sent

ask_user_draft_box: Current goal: Ask if the user wants to use the draft box
    Description: Remind the user that he/she can store email content in the draft box,
    when the user edits an email next time, the contents of the draft box can be used directly.
    Ask if the user wants to use the draft box
    if (Want to use the draft box) then (save_in_draft_box)
    else (say_goodbye)
    
save_in_draft_box: Current goal: Save the edited information in the draft box
    Description: Call draftBox to collect edited information,
    and inform the user that it has been stored in the draft box

inform_user_to_register: Current goal: Tell the user to register first
    Description: Inform the user that since there is no email account, he/she needs to register first.
    After registration is complete, login, and then the mailbox can be used to send emails

say_goodbye: Say goodbye to the user

workflow.summary: This workflow guides a user through sending an email: it first checks whether the user has an email account (prompting for ID and address) and, if not, directs them to register. For account holders, it validates the recipient’s address; if invalid, the user can retry with a different address or cancel. Once a valid recipient is provided, the user chooses to send immediately or schedule/send later, with an option to save the message as a draft before ending the process.

workflow.text: The process starts with responding to an email by first determining if the user has an email account by asking for their ID number and the email address they wish to use. If the account exists, the next step is to figure out if the specific email can be found by asking for details like the sender and the time the email was sent. If the account does not exist, the user is informed that they need to register for an email account before proceeding. In the event the email cannot be found, the user is asked if they can provide the email information again. If they cannot, they are informed that the email couldn’t be found. If the email is found, the process moves on to inquire if the user wants to reply immediately or later. Choosing to reply immediately leads to assisting the user in sending the reply and informing them of the successful action. If the user decides to reply later, they are advised to contact support whenever they need to respond to an email. This flow ensures that a user is guided through the steps of email account verification, email search, and responding to emails systematically.

                        No:

                            End

                    User can provide email information again?
                        Yes:
                            Go back to the step of asking for information about the replied email
                        No:
                            Inform user: Email could not be found
                            End
        No:
            Inform user: Registration required before using mailbox
            End

apis.api_description: Exchange rate query based on the currency proposed by the user

exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate, positive floating point, e.g. 7.322

apis.api_description: Currency exchange

exchanged_currency_name.description: Name of the exchanged currency, enumeration type, ["USD", "EUR", "JPY", "GBP", "CAD", "AUD", "CHF", "INR", "SGD"]

exchange_direction.description: Direction of exchange, enumeration type, [settlement, sale]

exchange_quantity.description: Exchanged quantity to be a positive floating point number. The unit is the standard unit of the currency to be exchanged

exchange_result.description: Redemption results, enumeration type, [success, no exchange times, exceed the foreign exchange limit, insufficient balance]

workflow.text: The flowchart describes a process that starts with determining whether a user wants to know about the exchange rate or convert currency directly. If the user opts to know the exchange rate, a function called acquisitionRate is called to provide the user with the current exchange rates. On the other hand, if the user wishes to exchange currency directly, another function, exchangeMoney, is invoked to perform the currency exchange. The success of this operation is then checked. If the exchange is successful, the user is instructed to check their account for the exchanged currency. If not successful, the process determines the cause of the failure, which could be due to having no exchange times left for the year, exceeding the foreign exchange limit, or having an insufficient balance. Depending on the cause, the user is advised accordingly, either to visit the counter of the People's Bank of China for more exchanges or applying for exceeding the limit, or to check their balance if it's insufficient.
workflow.flowchart:
：
flowchart TD
WB000(Start)--Exchange currency-->WB001[Subgoal: confirm the user's intent.
Description: ask if the user wants to know about the exchange rate first or convert the currency directly.]
WB001-- Know about the exchange rate-->WB002>[Subgoal: inform the user of the exchange rate
Description: call acquisitionRate, and tell the user of the exchange rate based on the returned exchange_rate_table]
WB001--Exchange currency directly-->WB003[Subgoal: check if the operation is successful.
Description: call exchangeMoney to exchange currency, and check if it is success according to the returned exchange_result.]
WB003--Is success-->WB004[Tell the user to check the currency that has been sent to his/her account]
WB003--Isn't success-->WB005[Subgoal: confirm the cause of failure.
Description: judge which of the following is corresponding: no exchange times, exceed the foreign exchange limit, or have an insufficient balance based on the returned exchange_result]
WB005--No exchange times-->WB006[Explain that the number of Express Redemption times for this year has been used up, so they have to go to the counter of the People's Bank of China to conduct this]
WB005--Exceed the foreign exchange limit-->WB007[Inform that the foreign exchange control limit has been exceeded, please go to the counter of the People's Bank of China to apply for]
WB005--Insufficient balance-->WB008[Inform that the balance in the account is insufficient]
workflow.summary: The workflow lets a user choose between viewing current exchange rates (acquisitionRate) or performing a currency exchange (exchangeMoney). If the exchange succeeds the user is told to check their account; if it fails the system identifies whether the cause is no remaining annual exchanges, exceeding the foreign-exchange limit, or insufficient balance and advises the user to visit the People's Bank counter, apply for exception/limit increase, or check their balance accordingly.

apis.api_description: Find ATM location

now_locate.description: The user's current location. If the user does not provide it, it will be fetched automatically. The format is: province and city + district and county + road name + road number, such as "No. 1278, Xunyu Road, Nanfei City, Jiangyu Province"

bank_name.description: Bank name, e.g. "Industrial and Commercial Bank of China in Shanghai Pudong Century Park", "Bank of China in Shenzhen Futian CBD"

quantity.description: Quantity, a positive integer, indicates the number of ATMs in the online store

location.description: Location, in the format: city + district and county + road name + road number, such as "No. 18 Chaoyang Road, Dongcheng District, Beijing", "No. 22, Nanjing West Road, Jing'an District, Shanghai"

apis.api_description: Verify the user's identity

card_num.description: Bank card number, UnionPay standard card numbers are generally 16-19 digits long

test_value.description: Identity is true or not, enumeration type, for example[true, false]

apis.api_description: Withdrawal intent review

withdrawal_intent.description: The intention of the withdrawal, what it is used for.

withdrawal_amount.description: The amount of the withdrawal, positive integer

is_success.description: Whether the review passed or not, enumeration type, for example[success, failed]

apis.api_description: Schedule large cash withdrawals

withdrawal_bank.description: Banks for withdrawals, such as "Industrial and Commercial Bank of China in Shanghai Pudong Century Park", "CITIC Bank in Tianjin Heping 5th Avenue"

withdrawal_amount.description: The amount of the withdrawal, positive integer

number.description: The number of days the withdrawal has been made, 1~15

workflow.text: The process starts with scheduling a withdrawal where the user needs to confirm the withdrawal amount. If it's 20,000 RMB or less, the withdrawal can be completed directly at an ATM without the need for an appointment. However, for amounts exceeding 20,000 RMB, an appointment is necessary. The user is then guided on how to find an ATM, which are generally located in each outlet and can be found using map software or by asking live customer service. The ATM supports withdrawals throughout the day as long as it has money, with a maximum of 5,000 RMB per transaction and a daily limit of 4 transactions, totaling a maximum of 20,000 RMB per day. If a reservation is made for a larger amount, the user’s identity is verified. Upon successful verification, the user must inform their withdrawal intention. If the intention is approved, the user can confirm the reservation details such as the withdrawal amount. After making a reservation, the user is reminded to withdraw the money at the reserved bank on the specified day with their bank card and ID card. If the reservation process fails, the user is informed of the reasons for failure and advised to check their account balance or visit bank outlets for further assistance.
workflow.code:
start: Start
  confirmAmount: Schedule a withdrawal
    if one-time withdrawal amount <= 20,000 RMB:
      findATM: Way to find an ATM
        informATMLocation: Subgoal: inform the ATM location
          searchATMs: Find the nearest ATM
            ->askUserLocation
            ->callFindATM
            ->informNearestATM
    else:
      makeReservation: Make a reservation
        verifyIdentity: Subgoal: verify the user's identity
          ->inquireUserInfo
          ->callVerificeInfo
          if test_value == true:
            confirmWithdrawIntent: Subgoal: confirm the intention to withdraw
              ->callIntentReview
              if is_success == true:
                confirmReservationDetails: Verification passed
                  ->findOutWithdrawAmount
                  ->callReservationCash
                  if reservationCash == true:
                    remindUser: Subgoal: remind the user to withdraw money
                  else:
                    informFailureReasons: Subgoal: inform reasons for the failure
          else:
            ->askForNewIdentificationInfo

If it is more than 20,000 RMB, an appointment is required.]
GK001--Way to find an ATM-->GK002[Subgoal: inform the ATM location
Description: ATMs are generally located in each outlet.
 The specific address can be found in the map software.
 Of course, the user can ask the live customer service about the nearest ATM.
 Withdrawals are supported throughout the day when the ATM has money.
 The maximum amount per withdrawal is 5,000 RMB, with a daily limit of 4 transactions, culminating in a total of 20,000 RMB.]
GK002--Find the nearest ATM-->GK003>Subgoal: search for ATMs

Inform the user of the nearest ATM location based on the returned ATM_dict.]

Description: Inquire about the user's identity information based on the returned VerificeInfo,
 and call VerificeInfo to verify whether the identity information is true.
 If the returned test_value is true, it is true. Otherwise, the user will need to provide new identification information.]
GK004--True-->GK005>Subgoal: confirm the intention to withdraw
Description: According to the instructions of the superior bank, the user must first inform the withdrawal intention when making an appointment for a large deposit.
Call intentReview, and judge whether the returned is_success is success? If it is successful, the user's intention is approved and can make an appointment.

workflow.summary: The workflow guides users through scheduling and completing cash withdrawals. Amounts up to 20,000 RMB can be withdrawn at ATMs without an appointment (subject to ATM transaction and daily limits); amounts above 20,000 RMB require an appointment and identity verification. Users are shown how to locate ATMs, confirm reservation and withdrawal details, and are reminded to bring their bank card and ID on the reserved day. If a reservation fails, users are notified of the reason and advised to check their account balance or visit a bank outlet for assistance.

scenario: Check the balance and transfer the bank card account

apis.api_description: Check the availability of the bank account

person_id.description: User ID number, 18 digits. The default is "130000200603213021"

person_card.description: User's bank account number. The default is "61111023267"

is_founding.description: Whether the bank account number can be found. Enumeration type, [found, not found]

card_money.description: Bank card balance, value + yuan, for example, "500 yuan"

apis.api_description: Check the last five transactions of the bank card

card_message.description: Return the last five transactions of the bank card. If the bank card has less than five transaction records, all transaction records will be returned. Otherwise, it will be empty.

transaction_time.description: Transaction time, year + month + day, for example, "May 3, 2050"

transaction_money.description: Transaction amount, value + yuan, for example, "300 yuan"

transaction_whole.description: The amount remaining on the card after the transaction, value + yuan, for example, "100 yuan"

apis.api_description: Apply for a bank card

card_form.description: Bank card type. The default is "Agricultural Bank of China Card"

person_value.description: User name. The default is "Wang Lin"

person_number.description: User ID number, 18 digits. Default is "130000200603213021"

person_id.description: User's bank account number. Default is "61111023267"

is_attends.description: Whether the application is successful. Enumeration type, [Failed, succeeded]

workflow.text: The process begins with handling banking services where the system asks for the user's ID number and bank card account number to check the availability of the user's bank account. If the account is found, the user is informed about their bank balance and asked if they have any questions about it. If the user has questions, they are informed about the last five transactions on the bank card. If the user has no further questions or after addressing their inquiries, they are asked if they need any other services. If no bank account is found, the user is asked to re-provide their information due to possible errors, and if they choose not to, the process ends with a goodbye. If other services are needed, the user can choose to apply for a bank card or transfer a bank card account. For a new bank card application, the user is guided through an online process that includes filling out an application form with personal and card details. The application is then processed, and if it fails, the user is asked to check their details and submit again. If the application succeeds, the user is asked for an address to send the card to, which will be mailed. For bank card account transfer, the user is instructed to use the bank's mobile app to change their password through the security center.
workflow.code:
Start
  Handle banking services
    Ask for information
      - ask the user's ID number and bank card account number
      - call queryBank, check the availability of the user's bank account based on the returned is_founding
        Bank account found
          Inform the user of the bank balance based on the returned card_money and ask if the user has any questions about it
            Have questions
              Inform the user about transactions
                - call bankInFormation, inform the user of the last five transactions on the bank card based on the returned card_message
                - The corresponding balance can be viewed in the transaction information
            No questions
              Ask if the user needs other services
                Other services needed
                  Ask whether the user wants to apply for a bank card or transfer a bank card account
                    Apply for a bank card
                      Inform of the online process of applying
                        - remind the user that only the online bank card process is available
                        - The user should first log in to the mobile banking app, click on the option of applying for a bank card, and fill out the application form, which includes name, ID number, contact information, and type of bank card
                        - Require the user to submit an application, call cardProcessing, and check whether the bank card application is successful based on the returned is_attends
                          Application failed
                            Notify that the application failed
                              - inform the user that the application is unsuccessful
                              - The user is required to check the name, ID number, contact information, and bank card type before submitting the information again
                          Application succeeded
                            Tell the user to wait for mailing
                              - inquire the user for the address to receive the card, and collect parameter: card_position
                              - Inform the user that the bank card will be sent by mail according to the returned card_position
                    Bank card account transfer
                      Ask the user to log in to the bank APP on the mobile phone, find the option to change password, then find the function to change password in the security center and other menus, and follow the instructions to change it
                No other services needed
                  Say goodbye to the user
        No bank account found
          Ask the user to reprovide information
            - tell the user that the account number is not found due to possible errors in the ID number and bank card account number
            - Ask if the user would like to provide it again
              Yes
                -> Ask for information
              No
                -> Say goodbye to the user

workflow.summary: The workflow starts by verifying a user’s bank account using their ID and card number. If the account is found, the system shows the balance, offers to answer questions (including displaying the last five transactions if requested), and then asks if the user needs other services. If no account is found, the user is prompted to re-enter information or end the session. Additional services include applying for a new bank card via an online application (with validation, retry on failure, and mailing the card on success) or transferring/ managing the card account via the bank’s mobile app security center (e.g., password change).

scenario: Make an appointment with a doctor

apis.api_description: Confirm the availability of the corresponding doctor at the scheduled time

planned_time.description: Scheduled time. The format is "day+hour+minute", such as "09:15 on the 19th"

if_feasible.description: Availability of doctors. Enumeration type, [available, unavailable]

apis.api_description: Check available doctors based on the time and department being queried.

department_name.description: Department name, such as "Obstetrics and Gynecology", "Otorhinolaryngology", "Dermatology"

planned_time.description: Scheduled time. The format is "day+hour+minute", such as "09:15 on the 19th"

doctor_list.description: The list of available doctors. If it is empty, it means that the doctor is busy at the time of the query.

apis.api_description: Make an appointment with the corresponding doctor

planned_time.description: Scheduled time. The format is "day+hour+minute", such as "09:15 on the 19th"

id_number.description: Patient number. It can be an ID number or a hospital card number. The hospital card number is 13 digits (ordinary card) or VIP + one digit (VIP level) + 5 digits (VIP card)

if_success.description: Successful or not. If it succeeds, it is "success". If it fails, it is the reason for the failure, such as "Doctor unavailable", "Doctor does not exist", and "Card number does not exist".

workflow.text: The described process begins with the initiation of an appointment with a doctor, where it's first assessed if the user knows their desired doctor, the appointment time, and the doctor's availability. If the user is unaware of the doctor's availability, a function, JudgeDoctorSTime, is called to confirm the doctor's availability at the scheduled time. Should the doctor be available, the user is informed and asked whether they wish to proceed with the appointment or look for another doctor. If opting to look for another doctor, the process loops back to confirming the doctor's availability. If the user has no specific doctor in mind, a function, findDoctor, is invoked to list all available doctors in the relevant department at the scheduled time. On the other hand, if the user knows all necessary details, an appointmentRegister function is triggered to finalize the appointment at the designated time. This function also handles the scenario of appointment confirmation, requiring users to arrive 15 minutes early for a registration fee, or it provides reasons for a failed appointment registration based on the response it returns. In situations where the initially chosen doctor is unavailable, the user is prompted to select another doctor, ensuring flexibility in appointment scheduling.
workflow.code:
Start: II000
    Make an appointment with a doctor
    Ask if the user knows the desired doctor, appointment time, and the doctor's availability?
        Yes, User all knows -> Call appointmentRegister
            if_success == success
                Inform user: Come to the hospital 15 minutes in advance to pay the registration fee
            else
                Inform user: Reason for appointment failure based on if_success
        No, User doesn't know the doctor's availability -> Call JudgeDoctorSTime
            Doctor is available
                Tell the user that the doctor is available
                Would you like to continue the appointment or check another doctor?
                    Continue the appointment -> Call appointmentRegister (as above)
                    Check another doctor -> Repeat JudgeDoctorSTime
            Doctor is unavailable
                Tell the user that the doctor is unavailable
                Request user to choose another doctor -> Go back to JudgeDoctorSTime
        No, User has no desired doctor -> Call findDoctor
            Inform user about available doctors based on doctor_list
            -> Ask if the user knows the desired doctor, appointment time, and the doctor's availability? (loop back to the beginning of the decision process)
workflow.flowchart:
：
flowchart TD
II000(Start)--Make an appointment with a doctor-->II001[Ask if the user knows the desired doctor, appointment time, and the doctor's availability]
II001--User doesn't know the doctor's availability-->II002>Call JudgeDoctorSTime to confirm the doctor's availability at the scheduled time,
and confirm if the doctor is available based on the returned if_feasible?]
II002--Doctor is available-->II003[Tell the user that the doctor is available, and ask if  the user would like to continue the appointment or check another doctor]
II003--Check another doctor-->II002
II001--User has no desired doctor-->II005>Call findDoctor to check all the doctors of the corresponding department at the scheduled time,
and tell the user about the available doctors based on the returned doctor_list]
II001--User all knows-->II004>Call appointmentRegister to make an appointment with a specific doctor at a designated time. If the returned if_success is success, users are required to come to the hospital 15 minutes in advance to pay the registration fee. 
If the returned if_success is not success, briefly describe the reasons for failure based on the returned if_success.]
II003--Continue the appointment-->II004
II002--Doctor is unavailable-->II006[Tell the user that the doctor is unavailable, and request the user to choose another doctor]
workflow.summary: A patient appointment scheduling workflow that checks whether the user knows the desired doctor, appointment time, and the doctor’s availability. If availability is unknown, the system verifies the doctor’s schedule; if available the user can confirm or choose another doctor, and if unavailable the user is prompted to pick someone else. If the user has no specific doctor, the system lists available doctors in the relevant department at the requested time. When all details are known, an appointment registration step finalizes the booking, informs users of confirmation requirements (e.g., arrive 15 minutes early and a registration fee) or returns reasons if registration fails.

apis.api_description: Access to doctors' diagnostic records

id_number.description: Patient number. It can be an ID number or a hospital card number.

query_data.description: Query date. The format is "year + month + day". For example, "November 8, 2044". If not filled in, it will default to today.

record_dict.description: doctors' diagnostic records. There may be different diagnoses from multiple doctors. If not, there is an error in the user's date or the user's information

is_check.description: Diagnostic information. Enumeration type, [Not yet diagnosed, requires medication, hospitalization, no treatment needed]

department_name.description: Department name, such as "Obstetrics and Gynecology", "Otorhinolaryngology", "Dermatology"

purchase_medication.description: Medication information. Being empty means no medication is prescribed

items.description: Medication names, such as "Tylenol", "White plus black", "Amoxicillin", etc.

apis.api_description: Order medication using a user-bound account

access_to_medicine.description: Access to medication. Enumeration type, [Hospital pickup, delivery, takeout]

place_receipt.description: Delivery address. The format is: City + District/County + Road name + Road number + Community name + Building number + Floor number + Household number, for example, "No. 10, Floor 6, Building 2, Mingzhu Garden, No. 16 Fengshu Road, Haizhu District, Yang City". Any modifications need to be filled out. If there are no modifications, the system will access the user's bound address.

result_text.description: Results information. If it is a failure, it is the specific reason, such as "Insufficient balance" or "Wrong address". If it is a success, the hospital will use the medicine pickup window, such as "001". If it is other ways, it is the order link. For example "medic.com/s/code=ea516d699ebfbe1ba90cdb26d7dade6551ba4d73"

workflow.text: The process begins with asking about the diagnosis and requesting user information, followed by calling a function to check the medical progress and confirm whether the doctor has issued a diagnosis. If the doctor hasn't issued a diagnosis yet, the user is notified to wait and possibly contact the doctor for another appointment if the wait is too long. If a diagnosis has been issued, the user is informed and asked if they need medication, hospitalization, or no treatment. For those needing medication, information is provided, and the user can choose a quick purchase using their bound account or pay at the hospital if their account isn't set up or lacks funds. If hospitalization is needed, the user is directed to the corresponding department's front desk for further instructions. Users who don't need treatment are reassured and advised they can seek a second opinion or psychological consultation if they have doubts.
workflow.flowchart:
：
flowchart TD
SO000(Start)--Ask about diagnosis-->SO001>Ask for user information, call getMedical to check medical progress, and confirm if the doctor issues a diagnosis based on the returned is_check.]
SO001--Doctor has not issued a diagnosis yet-->SO005[Notify the user that the doctor has not issued a diagnosis yet, and ask the user to wait for a while before coming back. 
If the diagnosis has not been made for a long time, ask the user to contact the doctor for another appointment.]
SO001--Doctor has  issued a diagnosis-->SO002[Notify the user that the doctor has issued a diagnosis, and confirm if the user needs medication, hospitalization, or no treatment based on the returned is_check.]
SO002--User needs medication-->SO003>Inform the user of medication information based on the returned purchase_medication.
Ask if the user wants to make a quick purchase.
Quick Purchase will use the cost of the user's bound account. If the user is not bound or has an insufficient balance, request the user to bind, recharge, or not use quick purchase.
If so, call orderMedication to order medication, and process information for the user based on the returned result_text. 
If not, request the user to pay at the hospital charge office, and then pick up the medicine according to the charge sheet.]
SO002--User needs hospitalization-->SO004[Inform the user of the need for hospitalization, and ask the user to go to the front desk of the corresponding department to make a record.
Specific information will be provided by the front desk.]
SO002--User needs no treatment-->SO006[The user is diagnosed with no need for treatment and asked the user to relax. 
Being doubtful, the user can go to a larger hospital or seek psychological consultation.]
workflow.summary: The workflow asks about the diagnosis and collects user info, then checks medical progress to see if the doctor has issued a diagnosis. If no diagnosis is available, the user is asked to wait or contact the doctor for another appointment. If a diagnosis exists, the user is informed and asked whether they need medication, hospitalization, or no treatment. Medication users receive details and can pay via a linked account or at the hospital; hospitalization users are directed to the department front desk; users needing no treatment are reassured and given options for a second opinion or psychological consultation.

apis.api_description: Retrieve a list of restaurants based on the user's location, cuisine preference, and dining time.

location.description: The location where the user wants to find a restaurant. City + District/County + Road Name + Road Number + Neighborhood Name + Building Number + Floor Number + Household Number. Here is one of its examples, No. 15, 4th Floor, Building 5, Bishui Manor, No. 23 Xiangshan Road, Haidian District, Beijing.

cuisine.description: The preferred cuisine type. Enumeration type, [Shandong cuisine, Sichuan cuisine, Cantonese cuisine, Jiangsu cuisine, Fujian cuisine, Zhejiang cuisine, Hunan cuisine, Anhui cuisine]

dining_time.description: The desired dining time. The format is "day + hour", for example, "12 o'clock on the 19th".

data.description: List of restaurants with basic details. A null value for this implies that there are no restaurants available.

restaurant_id.description: Unique identifier for the restaurant. Uuid format, for example, "28cecd28-6760-ec6b-a2ac-ae7e9b18a57d"

name.description: The name of the restaurant. For example, Chongqing Xilaifu Restaurant

address.description: The address of the restaurant. Its format is Province/City+District/County+Road name+Road number. Here is an example, 66 Jinxiu Road, Shenzhen County, Hunan Province.

workflow.text: The process described begins with the search for a restaurant, where the user is asked about their location, cuisine preference, and dining time. Based on this information, a function called searchRestaurant is called to find suitable restaurants. If no restaurants match the criteria, the user is notified and asked if they would like to search again. If the user decides not to search again, they are apologized to and the process ends. When a restaurant is found, the user is informed, shown a list of restaurants with details, and asked if they are satisfied with the options. If the user is not satisfied, they are notified that other recommendations are available and asked if they would like to see them. If the user is satisfied, they are told the restaurant's location and encouraged to visit it. If at any point the user decides not to continue searching for other recommendations, they are apologized to and the process ends.
workflow.code:
start: Start
    Search for a restaurant
        Subgoal: Check suitable restaurants
            Description: Inquire the user for the location, cuisine preference, and dining time, call searchRestaurant to find restaurants based on the criteria, and confirm suitable restaurants based on the returned data
                No restaurants found
                    Notify the user that no restaurants match the given criteria and ask if the user would like to try again
                        User intends to search for other restaurants => Subgoal: Check suitable restaurants
                        NO => Apologize to the user and say goodbye => end
                Restaurants found
                    Subgoal: Inquire about the user's satisfaction
                        Description: Inform the user that the restaurant has been found, display the list of restaurants and their details based on the returned data, and ask if the user is satisfied
                            User not satisfied with the option
                                Notify the user that other restaurants can be recommended, and ask if the user would like
                                    Need => Subgoal: Check suitable restaurants
                                    NO need => Apologize to the user and say goodbye => end
                            User satisfied with the option
                                Tell the user of the restaurant location based on the returned address, and ask the user to go to the restaurant to experience it => end

workflow.summary: The workflow collects the user’s location, cuisine preference, and dining time, then calls a restaurant search function. If no matches are found, the user is offered the option to search again; declining ends the process with an apology. If matches are found, a list of restaurants is presented and the user is asked if they are satisfied. If satisfied, the location is provided and the user is encouraged to visit. If not satisfied, the user is offered additional recommendations; declining to continue at any point ends the interaction with an apology.

number_of_guests.description: The number of guests for the reservation. A positive integer, the child counts as one.

available.description: Indicates whether the restaurant can accommodate the number of guests at the specified time. Enumeration type, [true, false]

apis.api_description: Books a table at the restaurant for the specified number of guests after verifying availability and receiving the user's contact information and special requests.

restaurant_name.description: The name of the restaurant to book. The format should be: Province/City+District/County+Specific Store Name+Street, such as "Chongqing Yubei".

special_requests.description: Any special requests for the reservation. For example, "There are two children."

workflow.text: The process begins with the user attempting to book a restaurant. Initially, the user provides the restaurant name, the number of people, and the desired reservation time. This information is used to check if the restaurant can accommodate the reservation at the specified time. If the reservation is possible, the user is notified of the availability. They are then asked for contact information and any special requests, and an attempt is made to book the reservation. If the booking is successful, the user is informed that their reservation is confirmed along with the booking details, with a reminder that not arriving within 20 minutes of the reservation time will result in forfeiture of the reservation. However, if the reservation cannot be made either because the restaurant is fully booked at the desired time, the restaurant's name provided is incorrect, or the restaurant is closed at that time, the user is informed accordingly. If the reservation is not available, the user is asked if they would like to choose a different time. If they say no, the user is thanked for their understanding and asked if they want to try booking for a new time, or if the issue was due to incorrect restaurant information or closing times, they are invited to provide the details again for a new check. If the reservation attempt fails, possibly due to incorrect contact information, the user is asked to correct the information and try again. This process ensures multiple pathways to accommodate or rectify the user's booking request based on different scenarios of availability, user choice, and information accuracy.

workflow.summary: User provides restaurant name, party size, and desired time; the system checks availability. If available, it collects contact details and special requests and attempts to book, then confirms the reservation and gives an arrival reminder. If unavailable (fully booked, wrong restaurant name, or closed), the user is informed and offered options to pick a different time or re-enter correct details. If a booking attempt fails (for example due to incorrect contact information), the user is asked to correct it and retry. The flow supports multiple paths to accommodate or resolve booking issues.

workflow.text: The process described in the flowchart begins with the start of a product search, where the system inquires about the user's needs regarding product type, brand, price range, and other specifications. This information is used to search for products. If no suitable products are found, the user is informed and asked if they would like to adjust their requirements. If the user decides not to adjust their needs, they are apologized to for the inability to find suitable products. Conversely, if suitable products are located, the user is shown these products and asked if they are satisfied. Should the user be satisfied and willing to buy, the product is added to the shopping cart, and the user is informed of the successful addition. If the user decides not to buy, they are asked for their reasons, which are collected for feedback. Alternatively, if the user is not satisfied with the product options, they are encouraged to consider other items. The user can either agree to look at more products, leading them back to the initial product search phase, or decline, at which point they receive an apology for not finding suitable products. This process allows for adjustments in search criteria and aims to find products that meet the user's needs while also gathering feedback on reasons for not purchasing.
workflow.code:
start: Start
    Search for products
    confirm needs and search for products
    inquire the user about product type, brand, price lower limit, price upper limit, and other product needs
    -> call searchProducts
    -> check whether suitable products can be found based on the returned is_finding
        if No suitable product found:
            ask to adjust the demand
            inform the user that no products meet the given needs
            -> ask if the user would like to change product requirements
                if Do not change requirements:
                    apologies to the user
                    -> tell the user that there are no suitable products and apologize
                    -> end
                else Change requirements:
                    -> confirm needs and search for products [back to search]
        else Suitable product found:
            show goods to the user
            inform the user of the product according to the returned apartment_message
            -> ask if the user is satisfied with the product
                if User is satisfied:
                    -> Ask if the user is willing to buy
                        if User will buy:
                            add products to the shopping cart
                            -> call addCart to add the current item to the shopping cart
                            -> inform the user of the results of joining based on the returned add_result
                            -> end
                        else User will not buy:
                            -> Inquiry the user about reasons for unwilling to buy
                            -> collect parameters: is_reason
                            -> persuade the user to consider other items
                else User is unsatisfied:
                    persuade the user to consider other items
                    -> inform the user that there are a wide variety of products
                    -> can fully satisfy the user's experience
                    -> ask if they want to know about other products
                        if Yes:
                            -> confirm needs and search for products [back to search]
                        else NO:
                            -> apologies to the user [flow ends]

workflow.summary: The workflow begins by collecting the user’s product requirements and performing a search. If no matches are found, the user can adjust criteria or end the search; if matches are found, the options are presented and the user indicates satisfaction. A satisfied user can proceed to buy (item added to cart); a user who declines to buy has their reasons recorded as feedback. Users unhappy with the options can choose to refine their requirements and repeat the search or end the process. The loop supports iterative refinement of search criteria and captures feedback when purchases are not made.

workflow.text: The processing flow begins with the management of the shopping cart where the system confirms the items in the cart by calling the function "lookShopCart" to retrieve cart information and informs the user of the cart's contents. Next, it asks the user if they wish to proceed to checkout, continue shopping, or modify the cart. If modification is chosen, the "changeShopCart" function is called to make changes; if an item model needs to be altered, it suggests deleting and repurchasing the item. The user is then updated on the cart's contents. If checkout is selected, the system inquires about the chosen products and, after double confirmation from the user, calls "shopCartCheckout" to finalize the purchase and informs the user of the due amount. It then asks whether the user prefers to pay using their account balance or a payment link. If the account balance is chosen but insufficient, the user is prompted to either use a payment link or informed of insufficient funds. Using the payment link involves calling "linkPay" to provide payment information and a link, checking for successful payment, and informing both the user and merchant about the payment status. If payment fails, the user is given a chance to complete the payment within 24 hours, or else the order is canceled. This flow ensures a flexible shopping experience, providing multiple points for decision-making and payment options, thus accommodating various user preferences and situations.
workflow.code:
Start
    Call lookShopCart to get shopping cart information
    Tell user the contents of their shopping cart
Ask user if they want to check out, continue purchasing, or modify the shopping cart
if the user wants to modify the shopping cart
    Call changeShopCart to modify the shopping cart
    If modification involves the model, delete and repurchase
    Tell user the updated contents of their shopping cart
    Go back to asking user if they want to check out, continue purchasing, or modify the shopping cart
else if the user chooses to check out
    Inquire the user about the product they checked out
    Call shopCartCheckout after the user confirms twice
    Tell the user the amount based on the returned money
    Ask the user if they want to use account balance or a link to pay
    if the user chooses to use account balance
        Call useAccountBalance to verify account balance and pay
        if payment is successful (pay_result is yes)
            Let the user know payment is successful and the merchant is being notified
        else
            Tell the user that the balance is insufficient
            Ask if they want to use the link to pay
    if the user chooses to use the link to pay or if balance was insufficient
        Call linkPay to get payment information and payment link
        if the returned result_pay is success
            Let the user know that the payment is successful and the merchant is being notified
        else
            Inform the user of the payment link and ask them to pay
            Ask the user if the payment is completed
            if payment is completed
                Go back to checking if the returned result_pay is success
            else
                Tell the user they need to pay within 24 hours, or the order will be canceled

workflow.summary: The workflow guides a user from reviewing their shopping cart to completing an order. It starts by retrieving and presenting cart contents, then lets the user continue shopping, modify the cart, or proceed to checkout (with an option to delete and repurchase if a model must change). At checkout the user confirms items, the order is finalized, and a payment method is chosen—either account balance (with insufficient-funds handling) or a payment link generated via linkPay. Payment status is verified and both user and merchant are informed; if payment fails, the user has a 24-hour window to complete payment before the order is canceled. Multiple decision points and payment options provide flexibility throughout the process.

workflow.text: The process begins with checking an order where the system retrieves brief order information through a function called lookOrders. If the user's account is normal, they are provided with rough order details; if not, they're asked to correct their account information. Following this, the system inquires if the user wishes to proceed with any specific order. If they do not, a farewell is extended. If they wish to proceed, the system asks which order they'd like to operate on and checks its current status. If the goods have been received, the user is informed and asked if they want to return the product. Should they decide not to return it, it's explained that only received orders can be returned. The system then inquires if there are any other orders the user wishes to operate on. If the goods have not been received, the user is asked whether they want to check order information, cancel the order, expedite it, or change the address. Choosing to check order information triggers a function to provide detailed order information. Opting not to check leads to an operation on the order with the result communicated to the user. This process loops back to asking if there are other orders to operate on until the user decides there are none, concluding the interaction.

Description: call viewDetails to obtain detailed order information, and deliver the information to the user based on the returned value of viewDetails.]

Description: call orderOperate to do order operation, and tell the result to the user according to the returned result_order]
workflow.summary: The workflow retrieves brief order info via lookOrders and verifies the user’s account. If the account is valid, rough order details are shown; otherwise the user is asked to correct account information. The system then asks if the user wants to act on an order; if not, the session ends. If the user chooses to proceed, they select an order and its status is checked. For received orders the user can opt to return it (or be told returns require received status). For unreceived orders the user can view detailed info, cancel, expedite, or change the address; chosen actions are performed and results communicated. This loop repeats until the user has no more orders to operate on, then the interaction concludes.

apis.api_description: Make a request for document printing

file_code.description: The file number is usually the MD5 code of the file, such as "49aa6f1abbb36907"

file_color.description: Color, enumeration type, [grayscale printing, full color printing], default grayscale printing

file_min.description: Print surface, enumeration type, [single-sided, duplex], default double-sided

workflow.text: The process begins with printing documents, where it's crucial to confirm if the user has uploaded the files to the company's system. This step is important because files need to be uploaded and reviewed before printing to avoid printing documents that shouldn't be. If the files haven't been uploaded, the user is instructed to upload the files to the system and notify the staff after obtaining a file ID for auditing purposes. If the files are already uploaded, the next step is to confirm the number of copies needed and any specific requirements like color printing; otherwise, documents are printed in black and white, one copy by default. The system then schedules the print job based on the user's specifications. If the process encounters an error, indicating the file wasn't found or contains unprintable content, the user is informed about the issue and asked to double-check and re-upload the documents. Throughout this process, it's ensured that files are properly audited, and users are kept informed about the status of their printing requests and any issues encountered.
workflow.code:
start: Start
  Print documents

confirm_file_location: Current goal: Confirm the file location
  Description: Ask if the files printed by the user are uploaded to the company's system.
  Files need to be uploaded to the company's system and must be reviewed before being printed,
  preventing some documents that cannot be printed but are printed

not_uploaded: Current goal: Let the user upload files
  Description: Tell the user to upload files beforehand,
  and tell us to print them after obtaining the file ID. This is for auditing.

uploaded: Current goal: Confirm the number of copies printed and other requirements
  Description: Ask if the user has other printing needs, such as color requirements.
  If not, then the document is printed in black and white, one copy.

schedule_print: Current goal: Schedule a print
  Description: Call getPrint, select the parameters according to the user's needs, and enter the parameters.
  After the call is completed, determine whether the returned is_success is normal or incorrect.
  If the returned is_success is an error, the file was not found.

inform_printing: Current goal: Inform printing matters
  Description: Tell the user that files have been obtained.
  The documents will be reviewed first,
  and then be printed after it has been approved.

file_error: Current goal: Tell the user about the file error.
  Description: Inform the user that the file was not searchable 
  because it contains content that cannot be printed.
  The user needs to double-check the documents and re-upload them before letting stuff know.

start -> confirm_file_location
confirm_file_location -> not_uploaded -> uploaded -> schedule_print
confirm_file_location -> uploaded
schedule_print -> inform_printing
schedule_print -> file_error

workflow.summary: The workflow ensures documents are uploaded and audited before printing. It starts by checking whether the user has uploaded files to the company system; if not, the user must upload them and provide a file ID for auditing. If files are present, the operator confirms copy count and color requirements (default: one black-and-white copy) and schedules the print job accordingly. Errors such as missing or unprintable files trigger notifications asking the user to verify and re-upload. Throughout, file auditability and user notifications about status and issues are maintained.

apis.api_description: Get the result of the file print

is_result.description: Print result, enumeration type, [Successful application, unsuccessful application]

locations.description: Storage location, in the format: floor + machine name + machine number, such as "2nd floor nest No. 2"

pick_up_umber.description: Pickup number, 8 digits 0~9 digits, such as "37889172"

page_num.description: Number of pages of the document, positive integer

apis.api_description: Get the identity of the employee in the current conversation

sever_ip.description: Server IP, IPv4 format, for example "127.0.0.1". If the function does not return the correct data, can add this parameter and call it again

employess_num.description: Employee ID, in the format of 3 uppercase letters + 5 numbers, for example, TTL40300

workflow.text: The process begins with notifying the employee of the file result, where the first step is to confirm the employee's identity by asking for their name and employee number. This is checked by calling the `getEmployeeStatus` function, and if the identity is verified correctly, the employee is informed about the document printing result, and the process moves forward. However, if the identity is incorrect, an apology is issued to the user. Next, the process involves getting the print result of the file by calling `getPrintResults` to determine if the application was successful. If successful, the number of pages in the document is confirmed with the user to prevent information leakage. Depending on whether the user provides the correct number of pages, they are either asked how they wish to receive the file (pick up by themselves or delivered by staff) or informed about the failure to deliver the document due to inconsistency in the number of pages. If the user opts for picking up the document themselves, they are informed of the location and pickup number. If the delivery option is chosen, the user’s workstation location is collected to schedule the delivery, with a note that if no one is present at the workstation, delivery will not be made. If the application for printing was unsuccessful, the user is informed of the reason, which could be due to the file not meeting specifications or being too large, and they are advised to contact the person in charge for more details.
workflow.code:
Start:
    Notify the file result
    goto Confirm_User_Identity

Confirm_User_Identity:
    # Current goal: Confirm the user's identity
    # Description: Ask for the identity of the employee who answered the phone,
    # including name and employee number.
    # Call getEmployeeStatus to get the employee status,
    # and judge the identity of the employee based on the returned employee_name and employee_num.
    # If the identity is correct, the employee will be informed of the result of the document printing.
    # Only if the identity is correct, the following steps can be proceeded.
    # If the identity is wrong, apologize to the user.
    if identity is correct:
        goto Get_File_Print_Result
    else:
        Apologize to the user
        end

Get_File_Print_Result:
    # Current goal: Get the result of the file print
    # Description: Call getPrintResults to get the file print result,
    # and according to the returned is_result
    # to determine whether the application is successful or not.
    if application is successful:
        goto Confirm_Document_Pages
    else:
        goto Inform_Application_Failure

Confirm_Document_Pages:
    # Current goal: Confirm the number of pages in the document
    # Description: We need to confirm the number of pages in the file with the user
    # so that we don't give the wrong file and cause information leakage.
    # Query the number of pages of the user's file based on the returned page_num.
    # The user cannot be told the correct answer.
    if answer is correct:
        goto Ask_How_To_Get_File
    else:
        goto Inform_Delivery_Failure

Ask_How_To_Get_File:
    # Subgoal: Ask the user how to get the file
    # Description: The user can go to the pickup location to pick the file up on his/her own,
    # or it can also be delivered by our staff.
    # The user needs to give clear requirements.
    if pick up on his/her own:
        goto Inform_Pickup_Location
    else if delivered by staff:
        goto Collect_User_Workstation_Location
    else:
        Inform unclear requirements
        end

Inform_Delivery_Failure:
    # Current goal: Tell the failure of delivering of the file
    # Description: Let the user know that the number of pages of the document provided is inconsistent
    # Deliveries are not possible in accordance with the Company's regulations.
    # If in doubt, the user can contact the person in charge of document printing for details.
    Inform failure details
    end

Inform_Pickup_Location:
    # Current goal: Inform the pick-up location
    # Description: The user is told the location where the file is currently stored
    # and its pickup number.
    # The user needs to pick up the file in time.
    Inform pickup details
    end

Collect_User_Workstation_Location:
    # Current goal: Collect user workstation locations
    # Description: Collect the location of the user's workstation and collect the parameter: work_place.
    # Tell the user that the delivery of the document is about to be scheduled
    # and the user needs to wait at the desk.
    # If there is no one at the workstation at the time of delivery, the delivery will not be made.
    Collect workstation details
    Inform delivery scheduling
    end

Inform_Application_Failure:
    # Current goal: Inform the reason for the failure of the application
    # Description: There can be two reasons for the application failure.
    # The first is the file is not up to specification.
    # The second is the file volume is too large.
    # The user can contact the person in charge of document printing to understand the situation and then re-apply.
    Inform failure reasons
    end

workflow.summary: The workflow informs an employee about a file’s print result, starting with identity verification via getEmployeeStatus. If verified, the system checks print status via getPrintResults: on success it confirms the document’s page count to prevent leakage and then offers pickup or delivery (pickup returns a location and pickup number; delivery collects the workstation and schedules delivery only if someone is present). A page-count mismatch prevents delivery. If printing failed, the employee is told the likely reasons (e.g., format or size issues) and advised to contact the responsible person. If identity verification fails, the process stops with an apology.

apis.api_description: Search for a suitable ride

travel_mode.description: Travel mode. The default is "High-speed rail"

travel_date.description: Departure date, year + month + day. The default is "February 6, 2037"

is_holiway.description: Availability of a suitable vehicle. Enumerated type, [no, yes]

holiway_message.description: Trip Information Sheet, being empty if no suitable vehicle has been found

travel_time.description: The specific time of departure, year + month + day + hour + minute, for example, "10:30 on February 6, 2037"

travel_position.description: The departure station location, for example, "Chongqing North Railway Station"

travel_price.description: Ticket price, numeric value + yuan, for example, "355 yuan"

apis.api_description: Confirm Ticket Status

person_number.description: User ID number, 18 digits, default is "130000200305211823"

is_tickets.description: Whether the ticket is paid for. Enumeration type, [payment completed, payment not completed]

workflow.text: The process begins with the initiation of a request for travel guidance, where the user is asked for information regarding their travel preferences such as mode of travel, departure and arrival points, and dates. This information is used to check for the availability of a suitable vehicle for the journey. If a vehicle is unavailable, the user is notified and asked to reselect their preferences. If a vehicle is available, details about the ride are shared with the user, including the option to accept the ride or not. If the user is not satisfied, they can choose to reselect their preferences. If the user decides to buy the ticket immediately, they are provided with a payment link and asked to complete the transaction. If the payment is not completed, the user is prompted to try the payment process again. Throughout this flow, if at any point the user decides to rethink their options or is unable to find a suitable ride, they are given the chance to reconsider their choices or are apologized to for not finding a suitable ride option. This flow ensures that the user is guided through the process of finding a travel option that suits their needs and completing the necessary steps to finalize their travel plans.

workflow.summary: User requests travel guidance and provides preferences (mode, origin/destination, dates). The system checks vehicle availability; if none is found the user is asked to revise preferences. If a match is found, ride details are presented and the user can accept, reselect options, or choose to buy a ticket. If purchasing, a payment link is provided and the user is prompted to complete payment, with retries offered on failure. At any point the user may reconsider options or be informed if no suitable ride can be found.

apis.api_description: Obtain the weather conditions at the pointing time and place based on the acquired geographic location and time range.

user_locate.description: User's geographical location. The format is: City + District/County + Road name + Road number, such as "No. 12, Yangliu Road, Wuhou District, Jiang City"

time_array.description: Time range. If left blank, only weather information for today and tomorrow will be provided, up to a maximum of 7 elements.

items.description: Dates. The format is year + month + day, such as "January 17, 2048"

weather_dict.description: The weather information sheet will be empty in case of error.

date_checked.description: Dates. The format is year + month + day, such as "January 17, 2048"

temperature_range.description: temperature range. The format is minimum temperature~maximum temperature, such as "17°C~22°C"

weather_info.description: Weather information, such as "overcast to cloudy", "cloudy"

status.description: Status. Enumerated type, [Normal, Date Error, Geolocation Error]

workflow.text: The flowchart describes a process where the system starts by offering weather services to the user, asking if they want to check the weather or turn on weather reminders. If the user chooses to turn on weather reminders, they are informed about the availability of morning, evening, and unusual weather reminders. For unusual weather reminders, the user is told they will receive timely notifications about imminent changes in rainfall and air quality. If they opt for morning and evening reminders, they are notified that they will get weather news for today or tomorrow at 7:00 and 19:00 every day. On the other hand, if the user wants to check the weather, they are asked about the location and date. The system then attempts to find the corresponding weather data. If the weather data is available, the user is informed and shown the weather forecast, with an option to check another location or date. If no data is found, the user is informed that the data is not available and asked if they want to continue the search. The process loops as needed based on the user's desire to continue checking or not. The flowchart concludes with the system saying goodbye to the user if they decide not to continue any checks or if they are done with setting reminders.
workflow.code:
start: Start
ask_service: Ask if the user wants to check the weather or turn on weather reminders

if (ask_service == "Turn on weather reminders") then
    inform_reminder_options: Inform the user that morning and evening weather reminders and unusual weather reminders are provided, and ask the user if desired one
    if (inform_reminder_options == "Unusual weather reminders") then
        inform_unusual_weather: Tell the user that imminent changes in rainfall and air quality will be detected in time and such messages will be sent to him/her timely
    else if (inform_reminder_options == "Morning and evening weather reminders") then
        inform_daily_weather: Notify the user that weather news of today/tomorrow will be sent to him/her at 7:00/19:00 every day
    endif
else if (ask_service == "Weather check") then
    inquire_location_date: Inquire about the location and date, call getWeatherForecast, and confirm if the corresponding weather data can be found based on the returned status
    if (inquire_location_date == "Weather data available") then
        inform_weather_available: Inform the user of the availability of weather data, display weather forecast based on the returned weather_dict and ask if the user needs another location or date
        if (inform_weather_available == "Check continued") then
            goto inquire_location_date
        else if (inform_weather_available == "No further check required") then
            say_goodbye: Say goodbye to the user
        endif
    else if (inquire_location_date == "No weather data available") then
        inform_no_data: Inform the user that the corresponding weather data is not available because of status, and ask if the user wants to continue the check
        if (inform_no_data == "Check continued") then
            goto inquire_location_date
        else if (inform_no_data == "No further check required") then
            goto say_goodbye
        endif
    endif
endif

workflow.summary: The system offers weather services with two main paths: setting reminders or checking the weather. For reminders, users can enable morning/evening notifications or unusual-weather alerts for imminent rainfall and air-quality changes. For weather checks, the system asks for location and date, tries to retrieve forecast data, shows results if available (and allows further searches), or informs the user and offers to continue searching if no data is found; the interaction loops until the user finishes, after which the system says goodbye.

apis.api_description: Retrieve a list of available hotels based on the user's destination, check-in, and check-out dates.

destination.description: The destination city or area. For example, Chongqing.

check_in_date.description: The user's intended check-in date. For example "2024/3/27". Year + Month + day.

check_out_date.description: The user's intended check-out date. For example "2024/3/27". Year + Month + day.

data.description: List of hotels with basic information. If this list is empty, there is no hotel available.

hotel_id.description: The unique identifier for the hotel. For example "CQYB0075294".

name.description: The name of the hotel. For example "Chongqing Jinyin Hotel".

location.description: The address or location of the hotel. For example, "15 Guihua Road, Yangzhou City, Jiangsu Province". The format is province + county + Road name + road number.

car_typeprice.description: The price for the stay is based on the given dates. It should be ¥+ a positive integer. For example, "¥299".

workflow.text: The flowchart describes a simplified process for searching and booking a hotel. Initially, the user is asked for their destination, dates, and preferences, and an API is called to find hotels that match these criteria. If no hotels are found, the user is informed and asked if they want to try a different selection. If they decline, an apology is issued for not being able to find a suitable option. Should hotels be available, a list is displayed to the user, who then decides if they are satisfied with the options. If satisfied, the user is asked to rate the service; a good rating prompts a thank you message, while a fair or poor rating leads to a request for feedback to improve future service. If the user opts not to leave a review, they are thanked for using the service and the interaction ends. If the user is dissatisfied with the hotel options, they are asked if they want recommendations for other hotels. If they decline, the service ends; if they accept, the search process starts over. This cycle aims to ensure user satisfaction by continuously refining search results based on user feedback and preferences.
workflow.code:
start: Start
    Search for a hotel -> findAvailableHotels
    
findAvailableHotels: Subgoal: Find available hotels
    Description: Ask the user for destination, dates, and preferences, call API:searchHotel to retrieve hotels based on the given criteria
    Available hotels found -> displayHotels
    No available hotels found -> noHotelsFound
    
noHotelsFound: Subgoal: No hotels found
    Description: Inform the user that no hotels match the given requirements, and ask if the user would like to reselect a hotel
    Reselect -> findAvailableHotels
    No need to reselect -> apologize
    
apologize: Apologize to the user for not being able to provide a suitable hotel
    -> end
    
displayHotels: Display the list of available hotels based on the returned data, ask if the user is satisfied with the hotel offered
    User is satisfied with the option -> askForRating
    User is not satisfied with the option -> recommendOtherHotels
    
askForRating: Subgoal: Ask the user for rating
    Description: Inform the user that the search is complete, and ask for an evaluation of this service. Criteria are categorized as good, fair, or poor for users to choose
    Good -> thankForGoodReview
    Fair or poor -> inquireReason
    No review -> thankForUsingService
    
thankForGoodReview: Thanks for the good review the user gives, and the user is welcome for further inquiries.
    -> end
    
inquireReason: Subgoal: Inquire reasons
    Description: Inquire about the reason for not giving a positive review, collect parameter: person_reason, inform the user that corrections will be made based on reasons, and thank the user for using this service
    -> end
    
thankForUsingService: Thank the user for using this service and say goodbye
    -> end
    
recommendOtherHotels: Subgoal: Whether the user accepts recommendations
    Description: Inform the user that this hotel may not match the given requirements, but other hotels can be recommended, and ask if the user needs
    Yes -> findAvailableHotels
    NO -> thankForUsingService

end: End
