workflow.summary: A looped hotel search workflow where the user provides search criteria, the system queries an API and shows matching hotels, and the user can accept options, ask for alternatives, or retry. After the interaction the user can rate or give feedback, and the process repeats as needed to refine results and improve satisfaction.

apis.api_description: Check the availability of rooms in a specified hotel based on the number of rooms and date requested.

hotel_name.description: The name of the hotel to check availability for.  For example "Chongqing Jinyin Hotel".

number_of_rooms.description: The number of rooms the user wishes to book. The value must be a positive integer.

check_in_date.description: The date the user intends to check in.  For example "2024/3/27". Year + Month + day

check_out_date.description: The date the user intends to check out.  For example "2024/3/27". Year + Month + day

availability.description: Indicates whether the requested rooms are available or not. Enumeration type, [true, false].

apis.api_description: Books a room in the specified hotel for the user after verifying room availability and receiving the user's personal and payment information.

hotel_name.description: The name of the hotel to book a room in. For example "Chongqing Jinyin Hotel".

number_of_rooms.description: The number of rooms to book. The value must be a positive integer.

user_details.description: Details about the user making the reservation.

name.description: The full name of the user. For example, "Michael Jordan."

contact_info.description: Contact information for the user, such as a phone number or email. For example, "18377281109" or "bronwKine@email.com".

payment_info.description: Payment details for the hotel booking.

card_number.description: The credit card number for payment. For example, "4063668888888888".

expiry_date.description: The expiration date of the credit card. Positive integer + years, for example, "15 years"

cvv.description: The CVV number of the credit card. For example, "2313".

reservation_successful.description: Indicates whether the hotel room reservation was successful or not. If it succeeds, it will be "true". If it fails, it will be the reason for failure, such as "An error in user information".

booking_details.description: The details of the successful booking, if applicable.

confirmation_number.description: A unique confirmation number for the booking.  The user's phone number is used for this number.

check_in_instructions.description: Instructions for checking in at the hotel.

workflow.text: The flowchart outlines a process for booking a hotel room which starts with the system asking the user for the hotel name and the number of rooms needed. It then checks the availability of rooms by calling an API. If rooms are available, the user is notified and asked to confirm the booking. At this stage, the user is warned that once a booking is confirmed, it cannot be altered, and they are urged to consider their decision carefully. If the user confirms, they are asked for personal and payment information to finalize the booking. The system attempts to book the room and if unsuccessful after two tries, it suggests looking for alternative accommodations. If rooms are not available initially, the user is offered the option to book a different hotel. If the user declines, the process ends with an apology for not being able to accommodate them. Throughout this process, successful bookings are confirmed to the user, and in cases of failure or unavailability, the system provides appropriate feedback and options, ensuring clear communication at each step.
workflow.code:
start: IW000
    Book a hotel room
    -> Confirm room availability

Confirm room availability: IW001
    Ask the user for the hotel name and number of rooms required
    Call API:checkHotelAvailability to check room information
    IF Rooms available
        -> Notify user rooms are available
    ELSE
        -> Invitation to book another hotel

Notify user rooms are available: IW002
    Notify the user that rooms are available, and ask the user to confirm the booking
    IF User has not confirmed
        -> Require the user to consider
    ELSE IF User confirms
        -> Whether the booking is successful

Require the user to consider: IW006
    Inform the user that once a booking is confirmed, it cannot be changed
    The user is required to think carefully and quickly before replying
    -> Notify user rooms are available

Whether the booking is successful: IW005
    Ask the user for personal details and payment info
    Call API:bookHotel to make the reservation
    IF True
        -> Inform the user that the hotel has been successfully reserved
    ELSE
        -> Try again

Try again: IW004
    Notify the user of reservation failure and its reasons
    Ask the user to try again
    -> Whether the booking is successful

Inform the user that the hotel has been successfully reserved: IW008
    Inform the user about the successful reservation

Invitation to book another hotel: IW003
    Apologize to the user for the unavailability of rooms
    Inquire if they would like to consider booking at a different hotel
    IF Yes
        -> Confirm room availability
    ELSE
        -> Apologize for not being able to offer a suitable hotel

Apologize for not being able to offer a suitable hotel: IW007
    Apologize to the user for not being able to offer a suitable hotel
    Say goodbye to the user

workflow.summary: A system-guided hotel booking flow that asks for hotel name and room count, checks availability via an API, and — if rooms are available — requests user confirmation (with a warning that bookings are final). After confirmation it collects personal and payment details and attempts to place the booking (retrying once); successful bookings are confirmed, repeated failures prompt alternative suggestions. If rooms are unavailable initially the user can try a different hotel or end the process, and the system provides clear status updates and options throughout.

apis.api_description: Retrieves details for a specific hotel based on the hotel name provided by the user.

hotel_name.description: The name of the hotel for which details are requested. For example "Chongqing Jinyin Hotel".

hotel_details.description: Detailed information of the corresponding hotel.

hotel_id.description: A unique identifier for the hotel. One example of it is  CQYB0027885.

name.description: The name of the hotel. For example, "Sheraton Chongqing Hotel".

address.description: The address of the hotel. The format is Province/City+District/County+Road name+Road number. For example, 88 Zhujiang Road, Shenzhen County, Hebei Province.

phone_number.description: The contact phone number for the hotel. For example, "023-88619910".

success.description: Indicates whether the hotel details were successfully retrieved.  Enumeration type, [true, false].

apis.api_description: Provide fees and payment links for user-specified rooms.

requested_time.description: The preferred time for the service. Its format is "day+hour". For example, "12:00 on the 19th".

room_type.description: room type, enumeration type, [standard single room, standard double room, accessible room, executive suite, deluxe suite]

service_type.description: The type of service requested by the guest.  For example, "Turndown service and gifts", "Face recognition service", "Connected Room Service", "Executive floor service", "Confidential check-in service", "Memorial Day service", "Exclusive bathrobe and pillow towel", "Buffet breakfast packing service", "VIP customs clearance service at airports", "Designated rooms", "Provide free activity classes".

live_time.description: Duration of residence, positive integers, less than one day is counted as one day.

room_number.description: Users can specify room numbers. One example of it is“05A11"

hotel_fee.description: This is the fee required to make a hotel reservation. It is formatted as "positive integer+ yuan/night". For example, "500 yuan/night".

pay_fee.description: Payment link, used to pay the room fee, is in URL format. For example, "zhifubao.com/s/code=87652f0bbbd7f8d0a22982a4ebae6019bcb50e8c"

room_info.description: The room number is finally obtained by the system. One example of it is"05A11". If the reservation fails, the reason for the failure is displayed.

workflow.text: The process starts with a task to book a hotel by asking the user for the name of the hotel they are staying at, and then calling an API to retrieve details about the hotel. If the hotel is found, the process continues by informing the user of the reservation fee and asking if they want to make a reservation. If the user hasn't confirmed, they are told that they can take their time before replying. If the user confirms, they are provided with a payment link for the reservation fee and the system checks if the reservation is successful. If it is, the user is informed of their room number. If the hotel is not found, the user is asked to provide a new hotel name. If the reservation fails, the user is asked if they want to try again or not. If they do, the process loops back to finding a hotel; if not, the user is apologized to and bid goodbye. This summary simplifies the flow of actions from booking a hotel to either successfully reserving a room or ending the process based on the user's decisions or the success of the reservation.
workflow.code:
start: Start
    Book a hotel -> confirm_hotels

confirm_hotels: Subgoal: Confirm available hotels.
    Description: Ask for the hotel name where the user is staying, 
    call API: getHotelInfo to retrieve hotel details,
    and confirm available hotels based on the returned success
        Hotel found -> reservation_decision
        Hotel unfound -> hotel_name_error

reservation_decision: Subgoal: Whether the user makes a reservation
    Description: Call appointmentFee,
    inform the user of the reservation fee based on the returned hotel_fee,
    and ask if the user wants to make a reservation for this hotel
        User has not confirm -> take_time_to_think
        User confirms -> reservation_success_check

take_time_to_think: Inform the user that taking time to think is allowed before replying
    -> end

reservation_success_check: Subgoal: Whether the reservation is successful
    Description: Inform the user of the payment link for the reservation fee based on pay_fee and request the user to complete the payment.
    Call appointment_Fee5 to organize the requested services,
    and check whether the service result is 'true' or not based on the returned service_scheduled
        True -> inform_room_number
        Reservation failed -> retry_or_quit_decision

inform_room_number: Inform the user of the room number based on the returned room_info
    -> end

hotel_name_error: Inform the user that there is an error in the provided hotel name,
    and request the user to provide a new hotel name
        User reprovides -> confirm_hotels

retry_or_quit_decision: Subgoal: Whether the user tries again
    Description: Inform the user of the failed reservation and its reasons based on the returned room_info,
    and ask if the user wants to reselect the hotel name and make a reservation
        User wants to try again -> confirm_hotels
        User does not want to retry -> apologize_and_goodbye

apologize_and_goodbye: Apologize to the user and say goodbye
    -> end

inform the user of the reservation fee based on the returned hotel_fee,

Call appointment_Fee5 to organize the requested services,

QX006--True-->QX002[Inform the user of the room number based on the returned room_info]

workflow.summary: The workflow collects a hotel name, calls an API to find the hotel, and — if found — informs the user of the reservation fee and asks for confirmation. If the user confirms, a payment link is provided and the system checks the reservation; on success the room number is given, on failure the user can choose to try again or end the process. If the hotel isn’t found or the user declines to confirm, the flow asks for a new hotel name or lets the user take their time before proceeding.

apis.api_description: Application for Seal

stamp_type.description: Seal type, enumeration type, [invoice special seal, official seal]

is_success.description: Successful or not, enumeration type, [true, false]

workflow.text: The process begins with identifying the type of seal needed among the official seal, financial seal, invoice seal, and contract seal, based on the user's requirement. If the user needs an official seal, it's determined whether it's required for documents like letters, official documents, contracts, and other company materials. If not, the seal is not required. For financial or contract seals, the user is informed that these seals are for exclusive use and not for external printing services. In the case of an invoice seal, it's essential to ascertain if the invoice is electronic or paper. Electronic invoices might not need stamping if certain criteria are met, while other types do. When stamping is required, it's important to confirm if the document is electronic or paper. For paper documents, the financial office handles the stamping, and the user must contact the company's head for the finance office location. For electronic documents, an application call is needed to request stamping, with outcomes visible in three to six hours, depending on the seal type. If no stamping is required, the user is informed that the print request cannot be approved due to non-compliance with company regulations.
workflow.code:
Start
    Use a seal
        Current goal: Confirm seal type
            Description: Seal types include:
                - Official seal
                - Financial seal
                - Invoice seal
                - Contract seal
                - Invoice seal
            Confirm which type of seal the user needs?
                Official seal
                    Current goal: Decide if an official seal is required
                        Description: The official seal can be used for all letters, official documents, contracts, letters of introduction, certificates or other company materials issued in the name of the company.
                        The official seal is not required in other cases.
                            Stamp is required
                                GOTO Confirm document type
                            Stamp is not required
                                GOTO Inform that there's no need to stamp
                Financial seal or contract seal
                    Current goal: Tell the user that the seal is not for external use
                        Description: Tell the user that the financial seal and contract seal are for exclusive use, not for external printing service.
                Invoice seal
                    Current goal: Ask for invoice type
                        Description: Ask the user whether it is an electronic invoice or a paper invoice.
                        If it is an electronic invoice, is the word 'Seller (Seal)' in the lower right corner of the invoice?
                        If not, it means that the electronic ticket does not need to be stamped.
                        If it is other types, it needs to be stamped.
                            Stamp is required
                                GOTO Confirm document type
                            Stamp is not required
                                GOTO Inform that there's no need to stamp
    Confirm document type
        Current goal: Confirm document type
            Description: Confirm whether the document to be stamped is an electronic document or a paper document.
                Paper document
                    Current goal: Teach the user how to stamp paper documents
                        Description: Inform the user that the financial office will stamp paper documents.
                        The user needs to contact the head of the company about the location of the finance office.
                Electronic document
                    Current goal: Request stamping
                        Description: Call applicationStamp to apply for a stamp. After the correct call, tell the user that the invoice seal will show the result after three hours, or six hours in the case of an official seal.
    Inform that there's no need to stamp
        Current goal: Inform that there's no need to stamp
            Description: Inform the user that the required print request cannot be approved according to company regulations.
            The main reason is that the application for a seal is not justified and does not meet the company's requirements or the use of a seal does not belong to the company regulations.

workflow.summary: The workflow directs selection of the appropriate company seal (official, financial, invoice, or contract) based on the user's need, then checks whether stamping is required and whether the document is electronic or paper. Financial and contract seals are restricted to internal use; invoice seals require determining invoice type because some electronic invoices may not need stamping. Paper documents are stamped by the finance office (user is referred to company leadership for location), electronic stamping is requested via an application call with results in 3–6 hours, and if stamping is not permitted the print request is denied.

workflow.text: The process begins with the confirmation of the user's identity. This is done by asking the employee who answered the phone for their name and work number, and then calling a function to get the employee's status based on the provided information. If the identity matches, the employee is informed about the print request result and the next steps. If not, an apology is issued to the user. Assuming the identity is correct, the next step is to obtain the printing results through a function call, and the outcome of the application (successful or failed) is determined. If the application is successful, the user is asked how they prefer to receive the document: by picking it up themselves or by delivery. If they choose to pick it up, they are informed of the pick-up location and number. If delivery is the preferred option, the user's workstation location is gathered, and they are told to wait there for the document, with a note that it won't be delivered if no one is present at the time of delivery. However, if the application fails, the user is notified of the reasons, which could either be non-compliance with document specifications or insufficient application information, and is advised to contact the printing supervisor before reapplying.
workflow.code:
start: Start
results_reporting: Results reporting
    :Current goal: Confirm the user identity
    :Description: Ask for the identity of the employee who answered the phone, including name and work number.
    :Then call getEmployeeStatus to get the identity of the employee, 
    :and judge the employee's identity based on the returned employee_name and employess_num.
    :If the identity is correct, this employee needs to be informed of the result of the print request and the following steps to be taken. 
    :If the identity is incorrect, apologize to the user.
    if (Identity is correct) then (yes)
        get_print_result: Current goal: Get print result
        :Description: Call getPrintingResults to get the printing result, 
        :and determine whether the application is successful or failed based on the returned is_result.
        if (Application is successful) then (yes)
            ask_pickup_method: Current goal: Ask the user how to pick up the document
            :Description: The user can go to the pick-up location or the document can be delivered to the user.
            :Ask the user to give a clear indication.
            if (Collect the document on their own) then (yes)
                tell_pickup_location: Current goal: Tell the pick-up location
                :Description: Inform the user of relevant information based on the returned getPrintingResults, 
                :including the current location of the file based on the returned locations
                :and its pickup number based on the returned pick_up_number.
                :Ask the user to pick up the document.
                end
            else (Delivery of the document)
                collect_workstation_info: Current goal: Collect the user's workstation
                :Description: Know about the location of the user's workstation, and collect the parameter: work_place.
                :Tell the user that the delivery of the document is about to be scheduled. Ask the user to wait at the workstation. 
                :If there is no one at the workplace at the time of delivery, it will not be delivered.
                end
            endif
        else (no)
            notify_failure: Current goal: Notification of reasons for unsuccessful application
            :Description: There may be two reasons for application failure.
            :The first is that the document does not meet the specification.
            :The second is that the applying information is not sufficient.
            :Let the user contact the person in charge of printing for information and then apply again.
            end
        endif
    else (no)
        apologize: Apologize to the user
        end
    endif

workflow.summary: The workflow first verifies the caller’s identity by confirming name and work number. If verified, it checks the print request outcome; on success the user selects pickup (given location and number) or delivery (informed to wait at their workstation), while on failure the user is notified of the reason (e.g., spec non-compliance or missing information) and advised to contact the printing supervisor before reapplying. If identity cannot be confirmed, the caller is apologized to and the process stops.

workflow.text: The process described in the flowchart begins with a start point that leads to asking a user if they are aware of any instances where they left early or arrived late. If the user is unaware of such instances, the next step asks if they checked in, leading to two possible outcomes: if they did check in but there's no record, it implies a check-in failure due to possible user error, advising them to follow check-in regulations next time; if they did not check in, the process inquires about the reason for their early leave or tardiness, which could be due to facial recognition failure, congestion, or other reasons. Should the user be aware of their tardiness, the process similarly inquires about the reason. For facial recognition issues, it attempts to collect the user's facial information and ensure its accuracy. If the user forgot to check in, the process evaluates how often this has happened within a month, leading to informing the user about their excess tardiness if it's more than three times, or simply reminding them to not be late if less. For other reasons not checking in, these are collected for further examination. The entire process aims to identify and address issues related to tardiness or early departure, ensuring compliance with check-in protocols and understanding the reasons behind these occurrences to provide suitable guidance or corrections.
workflow.code:
Start:
  Ask if the user is aware of any early leave or tardiness
    -> Unaware
    -> Aware

Unaware:
  Inquire if the user has checked in
    -> Did check in
    -> Did not check in

Did check in:
  Notify that the check-in failed
    -> END

Did not check in:
  Ask for the reason for early leave/tardiness
    -> Face recognition failure
    -> Forgot to check in
    -> Other reasons

Aware:
  Ask for the reason for early leave/tardiness
    -> Face recognition failure
    -> Forgot to check in
    -> Other reasons

Face recognition failure:
  Collect user's facial information
    -> END

Forgot to check in:
  Examine frequency of forgetfulness
    -> Exceeds three times
    -> Does not exceed three times

Exceeds three times:
  Inform user of excess tardiness
    -> END

Does not exceed three times:
  Remind the user of timing
    -> END

Other reasons:
  Collect other reasons
    -> END
workflow.flowchart:
：
flowchart TD
ES000(Start)--Early leave or tardiness-->ES001[Current goal: Ask if the user is aware of any early leave or tardiness
Description: The user has a record of leaving early or arriving late today, ask if he/she is aware of it.]
ES001--Unaware-->ES002[Current goal: Inquire if the user has checked in
Description:  If there is no record of early leave or tardiness, it might be due to the user not checking in at the time clock.
We need to ask if the user failed to check in on the time clock.]
ES002--Did check in-->ES007[Current goal: Notify that the check-in failed
Description: The user said he/she has checked in, but we can't find any records here,
it may be the user's operation error. 
The user needs to use the clock-in machine in accordance with the regulations next time.]
ES002--Did not check in-->ES003[Current goal: Ask for the reason for early leave/tardiness
Description: Inquire whether the reason for early leave or tardiness is facial recognition failure, 
congestion or other reasons.]
ES001--Aware-->ES003
ES003--Face recognition failure-->ES004>Current goal: Collect user's facial information
Description: Call getUserPhoto to get the user's face information,
and judge whether it is true based on the returned result.
If it is not true, it means the user's facial information is wrong.
Ask the user to re-upload until the returned result is true]
ES003--Forgot to check in-->ES005>Current goal: Examine frequency of forgetfulness
Description: Call recordForgotPunch to get the number of times that the user forgot to check in this month,
and determine if it exceeds three times based on the returned forget_num]
ES005--Exceeds three times-->ES009[Current goal: Inform user of excess tardiness
Description: Inform the user that their tardiness exceeds three times,
and it has been recorded by the system.
Let the user not to be late again]
ES005--Does not exceed three times-->ES008[Current goal: Remind the user of timing
Description: The user has not forgotten to check in more than three times,
and ask the user not to be late again next time.]
ES003--Other reasons-->ES006[Current goal: Collect other reasons
Description: Collects the reason why the user did not check in.
Collect parameter: other_reason]
workflow.summary: The workflow starts by asking whether the user knows they left early or arrived late, then determines if they checked in. If a check-in exists but not recorded it flags a check-in failure and advises correct procedures; if they forgot to check in it records the reason (facial recognition failure, congestion, or other) and, for repeated forgetfulness within a month, issues warnings when occurrences exceed three. For facial-recognition issues it attempts to collect or correct facial data, and other reasons are collected for further review. Overall the process identifies causes of tardiness/early departures, enforces check-in rules, and provides appropriate guidance or corrective actions.

apis.api_description: Upload the user's needs

worker_num.description: Employee number, 3 letters + 3~4 numbers, such as "ESE510"

workflow.text: The process begins with confirming the user's identity through getUserInfo. If the identity is verified, the next step is to inquire if the user's shift transfer request falls within or beyond three days. For an incorrect identity, the service is denied. If the shift is within three days, it's checked if the user has found a successor of the same level within the company; if not, the user is asked if they need help finding one or will continue the search themselves. For shifts beyond three days, the user is instructed to apply in writing through their supervisor. If a successor is found, shift information is collected for the transfer. If the user decides to find a successor with our help and exchangeable employee information is available, the user is advised to contact them directly; if not, the user is asked if they wish to upload their request for others to see. Depending on the user's decision, their request is either uploaded, or they're apologized to for the unsatisfactory service if they choose not to upload their information.
workflow.code:
start: Start
    relieve -> confirm_identity

confirm_identity: Current goal: Confirm the user's identity
    Description: Call getUserInfo to confirm the user's identity, and determine whether the user identity is correct or not based on the returned back_code
    Correct identity -> inquire_shift_transfer_deadline
    Mistaken identity -> deny_service

inquire_shift_transfer_deadline: Current goal: Inquire about shift transfer deadline
    Description: Ask the user about the shift transfer deadline. Is the shift time within three days 'inclusive' or beyond three days?
    Within three days -> ask_successor
    Beyond three days -> apply_in_writing

deny_service: Current goal: Denial of services
    Description: The user's identity is incorrect, so the user's request for a shift transfer is denied.
    -> end

ask_successor: Current goal: Ask who will take over
    Description: Ask if the user has found a successor, who must be another employee of the same level in the company
    No successor found -> user_needs_help
    A successor found -> collect_shift_information

apply_in_writing: Current goal: apply in writing
    Description: Tell the user that the shift time has exceeded three days and a written application needs to be made by the supervisor.
    -> end

user_needs_help: Current goal: Ask if the user needs help
    Description: Ask if the user needs our help or continues to look for a successor on their own?
    Find the successor on the user's own -> user_find_successors
    Find the successor here -> find_exchangeable_times

collect_shift_information: Current goal: Collect shift information
    Description: Call collectShiftInformation to collect shift information, and inform the user to have the successor contact us for a shift transfer and fill out the information
    -> end

user_find_successors: Current goal: Let the user find his/her successors
    Description: The user is asked to find his/her successors.
    -> end

find_exchangeable_times: Current goal: Find exchangeable times
    Description: Call getCanExchanged to obtain information on exchangeable employees, and check whether the information is empty based on the returned worker_object
    Information is not empty -> user_contact_employees
    Information is empty -> ask_upload_information

user_contact_employees: Current goal: Ask the user to contact on his/her own
    Description: Tell the user the employee information in the worker_object, and let the user reach out on his/her own.
    -> end

ask_upload_information: Current goal: Ask if the user will upload information
    Description: Tell the user that no other employee has posted a shift request, and ask if the user needs to upload information. After uploading information, other employees can see the user's application.
    Information uploaded -> upload_user_requests
    No information uploaded -> apologize_to_user

upload_user_requests: Current goal: Upload the user's requests
    Description: Call uploadUserRequest to upload the user's requests, and tell the user to be patient
    -> end

apologize_to_user: Current goal: Apologize to the user
    Description: Apologize to the user for the unsatisfactory service provided to the user
    -> end

workflow.summary: The workflow first verifies the user’s identity; unverified users are denied service. For verified users it distinguishes shift transfers within three days versus later. Transfers beyond three days require a written application via the supervisor. For transfers within three days the focus is on securing a same-level successor: if one is found, shift details are collected to complete the transfer; if not, the user is asked whether they want assistance finding a successor or will keep searching themselves. If they ask for help and candidate contact info exists they are directed to contact that person; if no candidates exist they are offered the option to post their request for others to see — the request is posted if they agree, otherwise the process ends with an apology for not being able to help.

workflow.text:
In a simplified natural language description of the flowchart, the process begins with a start point that branches into three primary actions based on the user's choice. First, if the user opts to check a ticket, the system calls a function named lookTicket to view the ticket's details. It then proceeds to inform the user of the ticket's specifics, including the content and any associated invoices, if the user expresses interest.

Second, if the user imports tickets via SMS, the system validates the new ticket by analyzing the SMS content. A function called checkTicket determines whether the ticket exists. If a ticket is found (is_exist is true), it is imported into the user's ticket package through a function named inBar. However, if no ticket is found (is_exist is false), the user is informed that the SMS content is invalid and advised to check the SMS content again.

Lastly, if the user chooses to send tickets, the system employs a function sendTicket to email the ticket to the provided address. The success of this operation is confirmed if the returned value is_success is true, indicating successful sending. Conversely, if is_success is false, the user is prompted to verify the email address provided.

This process encapsulates various tasks related to handling tickets, including checking, importing, and sending tickets, each with specific subgoals and descriptions guiding the user through the system based on their choices and the information provided.
workflow.code:
Start:
    if "Check the ticket":
        -> Check_the_ticket()
    elif "SMS import tickets":
        -> Validate_new_ticket()
    elif "Send tickets":
        -> Send_ticket_to_mailbox()

Check_the_ticket():
    lookTicket()
    -> Tell_user_ticket_contents()

Tell_user_ticket_contents():
    Print "Inform user the specifics of the ticket from ticket_dict"
    Print "Inform the returned ticket_ai to the user"
    Ask "Does the user want to know about one of the invoices?"
    if yes:
        Explain "the details of the invoice"

Validate_new_ticket():
    SMS_content = getUserSMSContent()
    is_exist = checkTicket(SMS_content)
    if is_exist == true:
        -> Import_new_ticket()
    else:
        -> Inform_no_tickets()

Import_new_ticket():
    inBar()
    Print "New ticket imported into the user's ticket package"

Inform_no_tickets():
    Print "No valid tickets found in SMS. Please re-check the SMS content."

Send_ticket_to_mailbox():
    is_success = sendTicket(email_address)
    if is_success == true:
        Print "Ticket sent successfully to the email address."
    else:
        Print "Failed to send ticket. Please check the email address."

workflow.text: The flowchart you provided describes a process for invoice reimbursement. The process starts with the user attempting to view their tickets through a call to the "lookTicket" function. If the function returns a success message, the user is shown their invoices and is asked if they want any of them reimbursed. If not all invoices can be reimbursed, perhaps due to expiration or previous reimbursement, the user is informed accordingly. If there are no invoices at all, the user is told to collect tickets first, with a suggestion that other processes for obtaining invoices might also be applicable. If all invoices are eligible for reimbursement, the process moves to a fast reimbursement step where "trimTicket" is called to generate a reimbursement link, which is then shared with the user. Following this, the user is asked if they want to submit this link for review. If they do not wish to do so, the process ends with a goodbye. Alternatively, if the user opts for review, further inquiries about submitting to the last section may occur, leading to a call to "reimburse" for final moderation. This entire process ensures that users can view, select for reimbursement, and possibly review their invoices in a structured and user-friendly manner.

workflow.summary: The workflow lets a user view their invoices via a lookTicket call; on success they see available invoices and are asked if they want reimbursement. If there are no invoices they are prompted to collect tickets; if some are ineligible the user is informed. When invoices are eligible, trimTicket generates a reimbursement link which is shared with the user, who can choose to submit it for review; if submitted the reimburse step performs final moderation, otherwise the process ends.

workflow.text: The flowchart describes a process where a user starts by applying for a substitute driver service. Initially, the system asks for details necessary for making a driving reservation like the time, start, and end points. It then consults its service via an API to check if a suitable vehicle is available. If there isn't a matching vehicle, the user is informed and asked whether they want to try selecting again. Should the user choose not to re-select, the process ends with an apology for being unable to find a suitable vehicle. However, if a vehicle is available or the user decides to re-select and subsequently finds a suitable option, the user is then informed about the vehicle model and asked for confirmation to proceed. If the user confirms, the system attempts to place an order. Successful orders prompt the user to leave a review, while unsuccessful ones result in an explanation of why the order couldn't be completed. User satisfaction with the service leads to gratitude expressed by the system, whereas dissatisfaction results in a promise to make improvements for better service in the future. This process leverages user data like free time, formatted as “year+month+day” (e.g., “2050年7月28日”), and interacts with various services (like listService and taxiService) to check vehicle availability and place orders, enhancing user experience by adapting to their needs and feedback.

workflow.summary: A user applies for a substitute driver service and provides reservation details (time, start/end points). The system checks vehicle availability via APIs (e.g., listService, taxiService) and uses user data like free time. If no suitable vehicle is found the user can try re-selecting or end the process with an apology. When a matching vehicle is available the system shows the model and asks for confirmation; on confirmation it attempts to place an order. Successful orders prompt a request for a review; failed orders return an explanation. User feedback is used to express thanks for positive responses or promise improvements for negative feedback.

apis.api_description: Determine if the reservation can be successfully cancelled

is_quit.description: Whether the cancellation was successful, enumeration type, [Yes, No]

is_reason.description: The reason for the unsuccessful cancellation, such as "The appointment time has exceeded 5 minutes", will be returned empty if the cancellation has been successful

workflow.text: The process begins with the attempt to cancel appointments for substitute driving. Firstly, it involves asking the user for their reservation information, such as ID number and appointment time, and then using this information to search for the reservation. If the reservation information cannot be found, the user is informed of this and is given the option to either make a new appointment, try to look up the reservation again, or end the interaction. If the user decides not to proceed with any action, they are politely bid goodbye. On the other hand, if the reservation information is located, the user is asked to confirm their intention to cancel the appointment. Should they be unsure, advice is given to think it over; if they're sure, an attempt is made to cancel the appointment through an API call. The outcome of this action is then communicated to the user: if successful, they are informed that the cancellation has gone through; if not, the reason for the failure is explained. This process ensures that users are guided through every step of cancelling their appointment, with clear communication and options provided at each stage.
workflow.code:
Start:
    Cancel appointments of substitute driving
    goto DetermineReservationInformation

DetermineReservationInformation:
    Subgoal: Determine if the reservation information can be found
    Description: Ask the user for the reservation information, including the ID number and the specific time of the appointment. Call getReservation to query. Determine whether the corresponding reservation information can be found based on the returned is_founding.
    if (Reservation information can not be found) then goto InquireUserDecision
    if (Reservation information can be found) then goto ConfirmCancellation

InquireUserDecision:
    Current goal: Inquire the user to make an appointment or look it up again
    Description: Tell that the corresponding appointment information was not found. The information can only be found after making an appointment. Ask if the user wants to make an appointment or look it up again
    decision:
    if (Make an appointment) then goto InformAboutAppointmentProcedure
    if (Look up again) then goto DetermineReservationInformation
    if (Neither is carried out) then goto SayGoodbye


InformAboutAppointmentProcedure:
    The user will be informed later by a dedicated staff member on how to make an appointment
    goto End

SayGoodbye:
    Current goal: Say goodbye to the user
    Description: Inform that the user is welcome to consult again if there are any needs. Then say goodbye to the user
    goto End

ConfirmCancellation:
    Inquire if the user is sure to cancel the appointment
    decision:
    if (Not sure) then goto ConsiderCarefully
    if (Sure) then goto DetermineCancellationSuccess

ConsiderCarefully:
    Advise the user to consider carefully
    goto ConfirmCancellation

DetermineCancellationSuccess:
    Current goal: Call the API to determine whether the cancellation is successful
    Description: Call cancelReservation and judge if the cancellation is successful based on the returned is_quit
    if (Cancellation is successful) then goto InformSuccess
    if (Cancellation is unsuccessful) then goto InformUnsuccessfulReason

InformSuccess:
    Inform the user that the cancellation was successful
    goto End

InformUnsuccessfulReason:
    Tell the user of the reason for the unsuccessful cancellation based on the returned is_reason
    goto End

End:

workflow.summary: User provides reservation details which are used to look up a substitute driving appointment. If the reservation isn’t found, the user is offered to retry the lookup, book a new appointment, or exit. If found, the user is asked to confirm cancellation; when confirmed an API call attempts the cancellation and the user is informed whether it succeeded or failed, with reasons or next steps as needed.

apis.api_description: Inquire about reservation information

workflow.text: The process begins with the user wanting to change their surrogate driving reservation. They are first asked for their reservation information, which includes an ID number and a specific time. This information is used to search for the reservation. If the reservation cannot be found, the user is informed and asked if they wish to search again. This loop continues until the information is located. Upon finding the reservation, the user is then asked if they want to change the reservation details. If the user confirms the change, they must provide the new origin and destination, and an attempt is made to change the reservation. If the change is successful, the user is informed of the success. If not, the user is told why it was unsuccessful and asked if they want to try to change it again. This loop also continues until a successful change is made or the user decides not to proceed, at which point the process ends.
workflow.code:
start: Start
    find_appointment_info

find_appointment_info: Current goal: Determine whether the reservation information can be found.
    Description: Ask the user for appointment information that includes ID number and specific time of reservation. Call findReservation to make a query, and determine whether the corresponding reservation information can be found based on the returned is_finding
    if (Information can not be found) then goto inform_no_find
    if (Information can be found) then goto ask_change_confirmation

inform_no_find: Current goal: Inform that the information was not found
    Description: Inform the user that the reservation information could not be found, and advise that the reservation information can only be found if an appointment is made, and ask the user if they need to look it up again
    if (Needed) then goto find_appointment_info
    if (Not needed) then goto say_goodbye

ask_change_confirmation: Current goal: Ask the user if he/she wants to change information
    Description: Inform the user that the reservation information has been successfully found. Ask if the user confirms that he/she wants to change it
    if (Confirmed to change) then goto check_change_success
    if (Not confirmed to change) then goto ask_to_think_over

ask_to_think_over: Ask the user to think it over before telling us
    goto find_appointment_info

check_change_success: Current goal: Determine if the change is successful
    Description: Ask the user for the origin and destination that need to be changed, and call changeReservation to determine if the change was successful based on the returned is_success
    if (Change is successful) then goto inform_change_success
    if (Change is unsuccessful) then goto ask_change_again

inform_change_success: Inform the user that the change has been successful
    goto say_goodbye

ask_change_again: Current goal: Ask the user whether to change again
    Description: Tell the user that the change is unsuccessful, and inform the user of the reason why the change was not successful based on the returned main_reason. Ask the user whether to change the information again
    if (Yes) then goto check_change_success
    if (NO) then goto say_goodbye

say_goodbye: Say goodbye to the user
    end

workflow.summary: A user requests to modify a surrogate driving reservation. The system asks for reservation ID and time, searches for the booking, and repeats the lookup until the reservation is found or the user stops. Once located, the user is asked whether they want to change the reservation; if they confirm, they provide a new origin and destination and the system attempts the update. The update is retried as needed until it succeeds or the user cancels, and the user is informed of each outcome.

apis.api_description: Searches for available ride options based on the user's travel details.

pickup_location.description: The location from where the user wants to be picked up. The format is: City + District/County + Road name + Road number. For example, "No. 23, Xiangshan Road, Haidian District, Beijing"

dropoff_location.description: The destination where the user wants to be dropped off. The format is: City + District/County + Road name + Road number. For example, "No. 88, Lanxi Road, Nanshan District, Yangshi"

pickup_time.description: The desired pickup time for the ride. The format is day + hour + minute, such as "11:28 on the 19th"

rides.description: A list of available ride options with details.

service_provider.description: The name of the service provider. Last name + last name.

vehicle_type.description: The type of vehicle offered for the ride. For example. The format is number of seats + vehicle type. For example, "5-seat commercial vehicle", "3-seat tricycle", "1-seat motorcycle".

estimated_cost.description: The estimated cost of the ride. The format is ¥+floating point number, for example, "¥27.38"

pickup_time.description: The estimated pickup time for the ride. The format is day + hour + minute, such as "11:28 on the 19th"

apis.api_description: Confirms the user's selection and finalizes the ride booking.

ride_id.description: The unique identifier of the ride to be booked. UUID. For example, "02f3dda1-6fa6-b7fd-3ee7-abd8a9706941".

booking_id.description: The unique identifier for the confirmed booking. UUID. For example, "c5dc3e8d-85ca-bf39-ec57-667663b6c8a7".

name.description: The name of the driver. Last name + first name.

vehicle.description: The type of vehicle the driver is using. The format is number of seats + vehicle type. For example, "5-seat commercial vehicle", "3-seat tricycle", "1-seat motorcycle".

license_plate.description: The license plate number of the driver's vehicle. The first digit of the license plate is a Chinese character, the second and third are English letters, and the last 4 to 5 digits are numbers and letters without the letters I and O.

pickup_time.description: The confirmed pickup time for the ride. The format is: day + hour + minute, such as "11:28 on the 19th".

workflow.text: The process begins with booking a ride where it inquires about the user's name, drop-off destination, and ride time, then searches for available rides to confirm their availability. If rides are available, the system presents these options to the user asking them to select based on vehicle type and confirms this selection. Upon confirmation, the booking is made, and details are provided to the user who is then asked to rate the service as excellent, good, fair, or very poor. If the user doesn't confirm the selection, they are informed that selections cannot be changed once confirmed and are asked to think carefully. Depending on the rating, if it’s excellent, gratitude is expressed and a commitment to maintain high standards is made. For ratings of good, fair, or very poor, thanks are given for the feedback with a promise to improve. If no review is given, an apology is issued to the user before saying goodbye. If no rides are available initially, the user is invited to re-enter their details, and if they decide not to, the process ends with an apology and goodbye.
workflow.code:
start: 
    Book a ride
    Confirm suitable ride availability
        Inquire about the user's name, drop-off destination, and ride time
        Call searchAvailableRides
        Confirm suitable ride availability based on the returned rides
    if Rides available:
        Confirm the selection
            Present available rides to the user
            Inquire about a selection based on the returned vehicle_type
            User is required to confirm the selection of this type
            if User confirms the selection:
                Ask for rating
                    Call confirmBooking to make a reservation
                    Provide booking details based on booking_confirmation
                    Ask for an evaluation of this service (excellent, good, fair, very poor)
                    if Excellent:
                        Express gratitude
                            Express gratitude to the user
                            Efforts will be made to improve services
                    elif Good or fair or very poor:
                        Thanks for the user's comments
                            Notify that efforts will be made to satisfy next time
                    else No review:
                        Apologize to the user and say goodbye
            else User not confirm the selection:
                Inform the user that the selection cannot be changed
                The user is required to think carefully before replying
    else No rides available:
        Invite the user to reselect
            Tell the user no suitable rides are available
            Invite to re-supply name, drop-off, and ride time
            if Yes:
                goto Confirm suitable ride availability
            else NO:
                Apologize to the user and say goodbye

workflow.summary: The workflow guides a user through booking a ride by collecting name, destination, and time, checking for available vehicles, and presenting options to select and confirm. Once confirmed, the booking is completed and details are provided; the user is then asked to rate the service, and the system responds with gratitude or an apology and promises to improve based on the rating or lack thereof. If no rides are available the user can retry or exit, in which case the process ends with an apology and goodbye.

apis.api_description: Obtain available vehicle information based on the given ride information.

original_pickup_time.description: The original desired pickup time for the ride. The format is: Day + Hour + Minute, such as "17:21 on the 23rd".

transfer_number.description: The number of people transferring. Positive integer.

transfer_loca.description: Transfer address. The format is: City + District/County + Road name + Road number, such as "No. 12, Yangliu Road, Wuhou District, Jiang City".

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user who initiated the ride. UUID. For example, "02f3dda1-6fa6-b7fd-3ee7-abd8a9706941". If not filled in, the system will automatically obtain it.

vehicle_info.description: Vehicle information. If not, there is no car available.

car_num.description: License plate number. The first is a Chinese character, followed by letters and numbers from 6 to 7, without the letters I and O.

arrive_time.description: Estimated arrival time. The format is: Day + hour + minute, such as "12:08 on the 19th".

arrive_loca.description: Actual meeting place, The format is: City + District/County + Road name + Road number, such as "No. 66 Guihua Road, Huangpu District, Yang City".

workflow.text: The given flowchart describes a process for handling ride changes in a transportation service. The process begins with the step "Start," where the service confirms the availability of changes by asking the user for the number of people transferring, the boarding time, and the boarding location. This information is used to call a function "lookTransferVehicle" to check if changes are possible based on the returned vehicle information. If changes are available, the user is informed about the currently available options and asked whether they want to select one. If the user chooses an option, they are notified that the reservation is successful, and their phone number is collected for a call notification when the car is about to arrive. If the user does not select an option, they are asked if they need to change their requirements. Should a change be confirmed, the process loops back to confirm changes availability; if not, the process moves to apologize to the user for the limited availability of cars and difficulty in securing rides, thanking them for their choice and suggesting they try again in half an hour. If initially, no suitable changes are found based on the user's information, they are invited to resupply their details to check again for availability. This loop continues until a satisfactory resolution is found or the user chooses not to alter their requirements, ending the process.

    -> Change possible
        -> Inform user of availability [HF006]

        -> Reservation successful [HF005]
    -> User does not select

Reservation successful [HF005]

    -> End

Ask if the user needs to change requirements? [HF002]
    -> Change confirmed
        -> Confirm changes availability [HF001]
    -> User does not change
        -> Apologize to user [HF004]
        
Invitation to re-supply information [HF003]
    Inform the user that there are no suitable changes based on the given information and search for appropriate information.
    The user is invited to re-supply the number of people transferring, boarding time, and boarding location to confirm again.
    -> Yes
        -> Confirm changes availability [HF001]
    -> NO

    Subgoal: Apologize to the user
    Description: Apologize to the user for the few cars and difficulty in hailing rides, and thank the user for choosing this service. The user is recommended to contact again in half an hour if necessary.
    -> End

workflow.summary: The workflow handles ride-change requests by first collecting transfer details (passenger count, boarding time and location) and calling a vehicle lookup function to determine availability. If options exist, the system presents them and, upon user selection, confirms the reservation and collects a phone number for arrival notification. If the user declines, they are asked whether to modify their requirements; confirmed changes loop back to recheck availability, while refusal leads to an apology and a suggestion to retry later. If no suitable options are found initially, the user is prompted to supply new details and the process repeats until a resolution or termination.
